|sernum = |wlclass = AN600 |series = |if = Mini PCIe |if_bus_version = |ifconnector = |formfactor = (half) |vendor_id = 168c |device_id = 0034 |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = PPD-AR5B22 |icid = 4104A-AR5B22 |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = |chip1 = Atheros;AR9462; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = U.FL |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |802.11n = 300/300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = |802dot11_protocols = abgn |accessible_UART = |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = reference design |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 02/03/2012 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== :aka '''WB222''': [[Atheros]] ''AR9462'' - DB 2x2 Wi-Fi + BT 4.0 *"WB222" and "250-02062-070" is silkscreened on the front of the board in the FCC photos. *"Qualcomm Atheros Â©2010,2011" and the Atheros logo is silkscreened on the back of the board in the FCC photos. ==Links of Interest== *[http://certifications.wi-fi.org/pdf_certificate.php?cid=WFA13356 Wi-Fi Certified] (02/23/2012, Wi-Fi Direct, HP) *[http://certifications.wi-fi.org/pdf_certificate.php?cid=WFA16497 Wi-Fi Certified] (09/03/2012, no Wi-Fi Direct, STBC, HP) ==Notes== ===Devices=== *This module is used by the '''VIZIO CT14''' Ultrabook (at least some models of). *Used by '''Acer C720''' Chromebook (module is confirmed on '''C720-3404'''). *Included on a PCI-E riser with '''Gigabyte Mainboard Z77X-UP5TH''' Rev 1.0 *There may be a [[Lite-On]] product using this [http://www.spinics.net/lists/linux-wireless/msg94339.html reference design] :168c:0034 (11ad:6621) PCI ID, 04ca:3006 USB ID :[http://h-node.org/wifi/view/es/763/Atheros-Communications-Inc--AR9462-Wireless-Network-Adapter--rev-01- Included in the Acer Z5771] all-in-one desktop PC :[http://support.acer.com/us/en/product/default.aspx?modelId=3959 Acer support page for the Z5771] only has Ralink Wi-Fi drivers :Seems to be included in the '''Toshiba Satellite C650''' *There may be a [[Foxconn]] product using this [http://forum.ubuntuusers.de/topic/w-lan-verbindung-bricht-ab-3/ reference design] :168c:0034 (105b:e052) PCI ID :Included in the [http://forum.ubuntu.ru/index.php?topic=197517.0 ''Acer Aspire One 725''] (RU) *Part of the '''Acer Aspire V7-581P''' *Used in the '''HP Pavilion 14 Chromebook 14-c001sa''' ===FCC Info=== FCC filings indicate that the module is used in the following.. *'''Acer Aspire M3 series''': '''M3-581T'''(G) (CII PC: 11/22/2012) *'''Acer Aspire M5-581T'''(G) (Model No. Q5LJ1) (CII PC: 05/08/2012) *'''DAP Technologies MT1010''' Tablet PC *'''Dell XPS 14''' (P30G / P30G001) (CII PC: 05/13/2012) *'''Samsung Series 5''' NP535U3C / 535U3C (CII PC: 05/31/2012) *'''Toshiba WT200''' Tablet (CII PC: 06/08/2012) :Possible subsystems of [http://forum.dobreprogramy.pl/ubuntu-waiting-for-network-configuration-t471128.html 144f:7055 or 11ad:6611] ([http://infused.co.nz/2012/06/12/toshiba-wt200-and-windows8-wifi-drivers/ Win8 drivers]) *'''Toshiba WT205''' (CII PC: 06/08/2012) *'''Toshiba WT301''' (CII PC: 06/08/2012) ===operating range=== * 802.11a: 4.900-5.835 GHz * 802.11g: 2.267-2.962 GHz * Bluetooth: 2.4000-2.4835 GHz ===iw list=== {{SCollapse| '''iw list''' dump (on Debian 8.1.0) |
Wiphy phy0
        max # scan SSIDs: 4
        max scan IEs length: 2257 bytes
        Retry short limit: 7
        Retry long limit: 4
        Coverage class: 0 (up to 0m)
        Device supports RSN-IBSS.
        Device supports AP-side u-APSD.
        Device supports T-DLS.
        Supported Ciphers:
                * WEP40 (00-0f-ac:1)
                * WEP104 (00-0f-ac:5)
                * TKIP (00-0f-ac:2)
                * CCMP (00-0f-ac:4)
                * CMAC (00-0f-ac:6)
        Available Antennas: TX 0x3 RX 0x3
        Configured Antennas: TX 0x3 RX 0x3
        Supported interface modes:

                 * managed
                 * AP

                 * WDS
                 * monitor
                 * mesh point

        Supported commands:
                 * new_interface
                 * set_interface
                 * new_key
                 * start_ap
                 * new_station
                 * new_mpath
                 * set_mesh_config
                 * set_bss
                 * authenticate
                 * associate
                 * deauthenticate
                 * disassociate
                 * join_ibss
                 * join_mesh
                 * remain_on_channel
                 * set_tx_bitrate_mask
                 * frame
                 * frame_wait_cancel
                 * set_wiphy_netns
                 * set_channel
                 * set_wds_peer
                 * tdls_mgmt
                 * tdls_oper
                 * probe_client
                 * set_noack_map
                 * register_beacons
                 * start_p2p_device
                 * set_mcast_rate
                 * Unknown command (104)
                 * connect
                 * disconnect
        Supported TX frame types:
                 * IBSS: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
                 * managed: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
                 * AP: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
                 * AP/VLAN: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
                 * mesh point: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
                 * P2P-client: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
                 * P2P-GO: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
                 * P2P-device: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
        Supported RX frame types:
                 * IBSS: 0x40 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
                 * managed: 0x40 0xd0
                 * AP: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
                 * AP/VLAN: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
                 * mesh point: 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
                 * P2P-client: 0x40 0xd0
                 * P2P-GO: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
                 * P2P-device: 0x40 0xd0
        software interface modes (can always be added):
                 * AP/VLAN
                 * monitor
        valid interface combinations:
                 * #{ managed } <= 2048, #{ AP, mesh point } <= 8, #{ P2P-client, P2P-GO } <= 1,
                   total <= 2048, #channels <= 1, STA/AP BI must match
                 * #{ WDS } <= 2048,
                   total <= 2048, #channels <= 1, STA/AP BI must match
        HT Capability overrides:
                 * MCS: ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff
                 * maximum A-MSDU length
                 * supported channel width
                 * short GI for 40 MHz
                 * max A-MPDU length exponent
                 * min MPDU start spacing
        Device supports TX status socket option.
        Device supports HT-IBSS.
        Device supports SAE with AUTHENTICATE command
        Device supports low priority scan.
        Device supports scan flush.
        Device supports AP scan.
        Device supports per-vif TX power setting
        Driver supports a userspace MPM
        Device supports active monitor (which will ACK incoming frames)
        Driver/device bandwidth changes during BSS lifetime (AP/GO mode)
}} [[Category:English Documentation]]
